channel.title: Talks on Abizer Nasir
channel.description: Recent content in Talks on Abizer Nasir

item.title: Safer Programming With Types
item.description: Summary A presented a lightning talk at Swift London with a simple example of how using strong types can lead to safer programs. Slides Available on Speaker Deck with speaker notes included.

item.title: Core Data It's Not Dead Yet
item.description: Summary I spoke at FrenchKit Conference in Paris on why Core Data should not be counted out just yet. Slides Available on Speaker Deck Video The video is available from Xebia’s YouTube Channel.

item.title: Being Imperfect In A Perfect World
item.description: Summary Just some thoughts on the choices we make about the patterns we use in development. Slides Available on Speaker Deck

item.title: Swift London Pre-WWDC Panel
item.description: Summary I was a late addition to this panel, which is my excuse for looking so scruffy. Video The video is available on the Swift London YouTube Channel

item.title: Dependency Management With Carthage
item.description: Summary Almost a year since the last time I gave a talk on this subject at NSLondon. This is an updated version about Carthage. Slides The slides are available on Speaker Deck Video The video for this talk is available on Vimeo

item.title: Carthage
item.description: Summary My NSLondon talk about the Carthage Dependency Management System. No need to manage your own submodules or use CocoaPods, Carthage provides a simpler and more flexible method of adding framework dependencies to Xcode projects. Slides These are available at SpeakerDeck

item.title: What Haskell Teaches Me About Writing Swift
item.description: Summary I had a chance to present a longer version of my Swift Summit Lightning Talk at AltConf 2015 in San Francisco. Just some personal thoughts on what knowing some Haskell teaches me about writing Swift code. Slides The PDF Slides can be downloaded directly. View the slides on SpeakerDeck Video Available on the Realm Altconf site References Here are the links to the references mentioned in my talk

item.title: What Haskell Taught Me About Swift
item.description: Summary I did a short talk at Swift Summit in London about a couple of things that knowing Haskell has helped me when writing Swift. Video A video of the talk, with synchronised slides can be seen at: Realm.io Slides Download the PDF directly from here View the slides on SpeakerDeck

item.title: FizzBuzz In Swift
item.description: Summary My NSLondon talk about the various approaches to the FizzBuzz problem in Swift, plus some thoughts on the new Language. My first mention in iOS Dev Weekly Slides The slides as a PDF file can be downloaded from here. You can see the slides on SpeakerDeck. Combined Download A zip file containing the slides and the playground is available here. Video The video of the talk can be seen at:

item.title: Adding 3rd Party Code To Your Project
item.description: Summary This talk covers two ways of adding dependencies to an Xcode project; using Git Submodules or with CocoaPoads. Slides These are available on SpeakerDeck Video The video can be seen at SkillsMatter
